basics.name: Clara Dragut
basics.summary: Eager to leverage an interdisciplinary background in Mathematics, Computer Science, and Philosophy to design cutting-edge analytics and machine learning solutions. Passionate about blending formal reasoning with computational techniques to tackle complex, real-world challenges in data science and AI.

courses: Applied Text and Natural Language Analytics
Financial Data Science and Machine Learning

projects.name: Prakrit-to-English Translation via In-Context Learning
projects.description: Investigated low-resource language translation using LLMs and dynamic example retrieval; compared TF-IDF vs. NMF example selection strategies; evaluated with BLEU and SBERT.

projects.name: Differential Privacy Mechanisms for Real-Time Data Streams
projects.description: Proposed a lightweight exponential mechanism for high-throughput privacy; reduced latency by 35% and increased accuracy by 15%.

projects.name: Structural Mediation Modeling in Urban Socioeconomics
projects.description: Led SEM analysis on 27,376 observations; found housing costs mediate ~77% of the effect of transportation access on employment outcomes.

projects.name: Causal Inference in Geo-Political Economics
projects.description: Used RDiT and DiD methods to study impact of conflict on global oil prices across 14 case studies; built reproducible Python pipeline.

projects.name: Sustainable Transportation Accessibility Analysis
projects.description: Developed framework using GIS, field studies, and interviews to evaluate London's cycle route accessibility.
